Fields.DialogueText: Captain! You better watch yourself - Tenryū has herself worked up.
Huh?
Don't say I didn't warn you. I'm trying to save my own hide.
*SMASH*
I TOLD YOU I DIDN'T LIKE THE TASTE! How many times do you need to be reminded?
*sigh*
Kanchou, you of all people should know that I can't stand this taste!

Fields.MenuText: Yes... it's a terrible taste!
I have no idea what you're yelling about.
How can you not like the taste of... whatever it was that you were eating?

Fields.DialogueText: Exactly! The brine and fishy taste of tuna does not suit my palate. Bring me catfish kabayaki! The fluffy white flakes and the tempura dipping sauce is a taste of the gods.
WHAT DO YOU MEAN YOU HAVE NO IDEA?!? Do you really expect me to eat this?!
HOW CAN I NOT LIKE THE TASTE? Tuna is DISGUSTING!
Calm down, I'm sure...
Telling me to calm down is the LAST THING I NEED TO BE TOLD TO DO!!
*ALARM*
Are those Morganas I see?
AHHHHH!!
I think she's going to explode with rage!
@BATTLE
Tuna?
YES, tuna!
Kanchou, try this! This, this right here is my favorite food!
What is it?
It's catfish kabayaki. Fried catfish strips. The crunchiness matched against the flaky white tender meat of the fish, all tied together by the tempura dipping sauce!
Before I do, let's just be clear - am I about to incur your wrath for reasons I'm not going to understand?
Why would I become cross with you? You're not planning on switching my favorite food with a disgusting tuna steak, are you? Because that would make me angry.

Fields.MenuText: Nothing of the sort! I just want to stay on your good side, that's all!
Well... now that you mention it...
Tuna is so disgusting! I wouldn't feed it to my dog!

Fields.DialogueText: You should always remain on my good side, Kanchou.
Better not test my patience, Kanchou. The crew will not like having you test my patience.
I have no idea why it's bid on so heavily at the Tsukiji market. It must be that people have very limited taste.
But catfish is different?
Oh, catfish prepared with some oil and lemon has no fishy taste. Catfish kabayaki is a sensation of textures for the mouth.
*ALARM*
Oh, bother...
... Of... all... the... TIMES!!
Well. This should be exciting.
@BATTLE
Kanchou!
Tenryū?
What did you think of our last battle?

Fields.MenuText: It was hard!
It was too easy!
I'm not sure... I'm still picking catfish nuggets out of my coat.

Fields.DialogueText: Right, this means we must practice and hone our skills. I was built to be the superior cruiser of my day.
Perhaps we should face more worthy opponents, then?
That kabayaki serves as a reminder to not unleash my temper.
Once, I was one of the most advanced cruisers on this planet. If it wasn't for me, the siege of Shanghai wouldn't have been successful. But now...
Your artillery and technology needs to be upgraded?
Of course not! A poor swordsman blames the sword and not their lack of skill. Technology is not always the deciding factor in a fight.
Can you explain more?
I don't fear the person who can fire 10,000 guns at once, but I fear the person who has fired one gun 10,000 times. Experience is what makes a warrior.
So you are content with your arms?
If I must upgrade my arms, so be it. But I have full knowledge that, only through dedication and discipline, will I become a threat with said arms.
*ALARM*
Now watch, Kanchou. You will witness what dedication and discipline can do to threats to Imperial Japan.
@BATTLE
It seems that Imperial Japan is still protected for now.
Should... we celebrate?
No so fast, Kanchou. While Imperial Japan is protected for now, the Morganas are still a threat. These ghosts of the sea threaten thousands of years of culture.

Fields.MenuText: And that's why we are going to destroy them all!
Morganas are our biggest threat right now.
What about those catfish nuggets?

Fields.DialogueText: Destroying them all is incredible. Securing the traditions and culture of Imperial Japan is honorable.
Is it Morganas? Or is it the threat of breaking traditions that have spanned centuries?
They pose no threat as they can be easily farmed. Aside from being foul tasting, fishing for tuna puts stress on the delicate life balance of the sea.
Wait... if you believe those things, then why is your fuse so short?
I don't have a short fuse. It's as long as it needs to be.
I'm not so sure about that...
If you had a cannon, would you have a longer or a shorter fuse in battle?
*ALARM*
I'll asks again... my patience is running out, so make it quick! Would you have a longer or a shorter fuse in battle?
And I can't choose neither?
NO!
Make it quick! A short fuse it is!
ARRRGGGG!!
@BATTLE
You certainly like to protect honor and tradition!
After everything, after we die and are reborn, honor and tradition survive throughout the ages.
I can't get philosophical... This is already far too complicated!
Then let us hone our skills in battle, but let us do with clarity and serenity.
Huh, you're concerned about the sea?
The sea, like much of the Earth, is guarded by spirits who become upset if that delicate balance is broken. I don't want the spirits to become angry and sink my ship.
Yes, Officer, what is it?
We've received a telegram, and we've all voted that, because you are the highest ranking official on the ship, you must deliver it to Kami of the Fleet, Tenryū.
What is the message about?
You'll find out as soon as her hidden dragon comes out.
You mean her temper? ... Officer? How did they disappear so quickly?
What do you have in your hand there, Kanchou?
Oh, uh, this little thing? I'm sure it's nothing.
Nothing, huh? Then why are you acting so nervous, let me see that!
What.... WHAT??? MISSING? STOLEN?!
What's stolen? My chest is feeling tight!
THE SACRED SWORD IS STOLEN?!
Which sacred sword?
Only the Chokutō Sword of Jimmu!
That's bad?
IT'S A NATIONAL TREASURE, SO OF COURSE IT'S BAD!

Fields.MenuText: Isn't there another one?
This must be why the crew was too afraid to break the news to you.
I wish the crew didn't disappear on me!

Fields.DialogueText: This is the only one. There was only one Jimmu.
The crew was hiding this from me?!
You are responsible for the crew, but the crew isn't always responsible for their kanchou. This is how leadership works. But I am angered that the crew deserted you...
*ALARM*
I'm also angered at the Morganas, the Funayūrei. Now they must face my wrath from all of the things that have angered me!
@BATTLE
Tell me about the sacred sword, Tenryū.
Every school child knows who Jimmu is.
Humor me.
Very well. Jimmu is the great-grandson of Ninigi, who himself was a grandson of the great sun goddess, Amaterasu. Ninigi was sent to Earth to pacify the land.
The great-grandson of Ninigi, Jimmu established the ruling capital for Japan. This makes the Japanese descendants of the goddess Amaterasu a divine population.
And where does the sword come in?
With the Chokutō sword, Jimmu was able to become the first emperor after establishing the capital! His accession day, February 11, is the Kigenetsu holiday.

Fields.MenuText: So this sword is like a founding document of Japan then?
That seems close to President's Day in the United States...
Where was the sword held?

Fields.DialogueText: Correct, it is a national treasure. Although it falls under the sword category as of 1935.
Western Presidents don't carry the divine blood of the gods.
The Chokutō sword was held in the Kashima Shrine, in Kashima, Ibaraki.
I fear for any enemies that may cross your path.
*ALARM*
Come on, Tenryū, time to unleash your inner dragon!
Don't fear the 10,000 dragons at once, but fear the dragon which has been unleashed 10,000 times.
@BATTLE
Tenryū... what are you doing?
I am honing my skills for battle. We must be prepared to fight back to get the sword of Jimmu and protect Imperial Japan!
By jumping around the room? I think I saw you standing on your head, earlier.
This strengthens my core. Your core must be strong, like a solid foundation, to withstand many battles.
Don't you feel dizzy?
Kami of the Fleet should be able to withstand a little dizziness. Can you pass me the blindfold there?
Yeah, sure. What's this blindfold for?
Ask any ship I've defeated in battle, and they will tell you that the legendary ship Tenryū can see in all directions. A blindfold helps me to see.
I don't understand.
A blindfold helps me to see by taking away my sight, but aiding my intuition. My body is trained to act in the absence of sight, quickening my reflexes.
Of course, all this takes the discipline and patience of a Kami.

Fields.MenuText: Belles can be very peculiar...
Can you really see in all directions?
Do all Belles train this way?

Fields.DialogueText: That better be in a good remark. Humans can understand all the reasons why a Kami of the Fleet must be the way they are.
I always know where you are on this ship...
Only the ones who wish to better their abilities will train. Some of them, though, think guns alone are enough to make them a threat.
Now... where was I?
*ALARM*
Hey, where are you going, Tenryū? Are you really going to wear that blindfold in battle?
I will fight by intuition alone. Watch and learn, Kanchou.
@BATTLE
Is this where the shrine is?
The Kashima shrine is a bit further inland, but I am meeting with temple officials aboard to discuss the disappearance of the Chokutō sword.
I want to offer my help to find the sword and restore honor to the history and tradition of the Imperial Japanese culture.

Fields.MenuText: What do you think of parliament? The actual duties of the Emperor ended three-quarters of a century ago.
What happens if the temple officials make you upset?
Do you have any leads on who took the sword?

Fields.DialogueText: Yet, the Emperor, the venerable Emperor Hirohito remains as is tradition. Look at England! The parliament doesn't need the king, and yet, King George VI remains.
They won't. It's as easy as that.
Not yet... Why someone would wish to steal such a divine relic is beyond me.
Any food you would suggest trying while we're here?
Oh, no doubt, zazamushi.
What is zazamushi?
Only the crunchiest, most savory, nutty dish. There are no nuts in it though. Zazamushi come from rivers that are aerated by rocks, the flow produces the "zaazaa" noise.
And mushi?
Mushi are the larvae. Mushi means insect.
*ALARM*
Whew! No bug larvae for me!
You better enjoy it!!
@BATTLE
Were you able to meet with the temple officials?
Correct.
What did you learn about the Chokutō sword's disappearance?
Some doors in the temple were broken at night, but no one heard them. They thought it was the wind rustling.
I think this means that we are dealing with people who can camouflage in with their surroundings. As to who it was, they left no trace.

Fields.MenuText: Do you think it was a group of people or one person?
Did the temple officials have any leads?
You don't like tuna, but you like zazamushi?

Fields.DialogueText: It is hard to say. It could have been a group, or one very skilled individual. A group is more efficient, but one person is better hidden.
The officials stated that it must be someone who knows the temple well, in order to pull off the theft so quickly.
Tuna is fishy. Zazamushi is nutty, savory and crunchy. Zazamushi doesn't taste like one has licked the sea floor.
What is your plan of action?
I haven't decided yet. But we probably ought to see to the incoming Morganas.
Wait, there are Morganas approaching?
I told you, I can see in all directions!
@BATTLE
I think I have solved why the sword was stolen.
Oh, you have a lead?
Not a lead, but perhaps a motive. I think the sword was stolen because it a relic which represents the traditions of Japan.
That doesn't tell me what the motive is.
The theft was a message - a message that Japanese tradition is vulnerable and could be overtaken by outside influences.

Fields.MenuText: But you still have no idea who took the sword?
If might be better to wait on assigning a motive until after we have a lead on who stole the sword.
What if it was an inside job?

Fields.DialogueText: Not yet, but if true, this might give us a lead.
Are you insinuating that my methods aren't ideal?
Why would a temple official steal their most valuable relic and the sword that belonged to Jimmu himself? It would make no sense.
*ALARM*
Ahhh, a simple motive. Morganas wish to destroy us, so we in turn try to destroy them. It's something I can understand.
Out of my way... questioning my detective work... that is NOT allowed... UURRRGGG...
@BATTLE
Kanchou, look at this!
What is it? Hmmm, the sword was seen in Cape Town, South Africa.
What's a divine sword doing all the way over there? I bet someone or something is plotting to destroy Imperial Japan!
That's an odd place for a sword to go. ... You want to investigate, don't you?
We should leave quickly! Projecting Imperial Japan is a duty I hold in the highest regard.

Fields.MenuText: The sword might be for sale somewhere in South Africa!
I hope they don't tamper with the sword!
What if they just give you back the sword?

Fields.DialogueText: They can't just sell a priceless piece of history like that. A divine piece of history.
Nothing would make my blood boil and my rage take hold faster!
They still must be punished for stealing such an artifact. Getting off like that would make my blood boil...
As the flagship of destroyer squadrons, my second highest duty is protecting the younger, smaller Maru-kun in my fleet. Protecting Japanese interests is what I do.
I don't doubt it!
I normally don't allow backtalk, but I'll take it as a compliment and give you a warning.
Yes, sorry! Don't want to unleash that dragon that's inside of you.
Every time you say that... it just makes my blood begin to boil...
*ALARM*
Unleash it on the enemy!
@BATTLE
The sword isn't here anymore!
Do you have any idea where it might be now?
Whoever had it was passing through... they weren't to their destination yet. I think we need to ask around, so we can get a better idea of who has the sword.
Once we find out who it is, we stay ahead of them. Then I lay my smokescreen, waiting to ambush, like a dragon in the clouds.

Fields.MenuText: What if we never find the sword?
What if we find the sword with no trouble at all?
Aren't dragons supposed to grant wishes?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, we will find the sword! I will it to happen, maybe through divine intervention, maybe through sheer rage. One way or another, it will happen!
Such as event would be ideal, though it seems we might be trailing behind at this point.
Only if you don't infuriate them first!
I will have the officers dispatch crewmembers to get descriptions of the thief.
*ALARM*
Morganas!
Don't put any of my younger comrades in danger! They lack the experience of a ship as seasoned as myself.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, would you look at this?
I would if you would hold still.
Nevermind, I'll just tell you. We've received word that the thief was seen in the port city of Lagos.
That must mean that they're making their way north?
Or, they might be headed west, to the United States.

Fields.MenuText: I think they are making their way north.
I think they are headed to the United States.
I'm all out of ideas at this point.

Fields.DialogueText: But how can we be sure? I don't want to take one step forward, only to fall two steps behind.
Why would the United States have any interest in such a sword? It's nothing but barren farmland.
This is why I enjoy being one of the most experienced Kami of the Fleet. My experience gives me an endless stream of ideas.
Before we head to Lagos, there is one item that needs brought to your attention, Kanchou.
What's that, Tenryū?
I see that there are Morganas in range! Let's prepare an ambush, Kanchou.
All right, all right.
@BATTLE
Captain, all I can say is watch out! Tenryū is in one of her moods again!
Was she served ocean fish again?
No! It's much worse than that - caution is advised!
Tenryū, what's the problem?
I'LL TELL YOU WHAT'S THE PROBLEM! The sword isn't in this town!

Fields.MenuText: Then we'll gather more information here in town and keep up the search.
Here, let's get some zazamushi and sit down for a bit.
Why don't you try some meditation?

Fields.DialogueText: We really need to identify who the thief is...
I'll wait here while you go get me some.
What's that going to accomplish? Meditating is just sitting... and I can't just sit idle!
I'll be right back with a bowl of zazamushi.
Hey, sailor!
Captain! What'll it be this time? More catfish nuggets?
No, not today, Kami Tenryū is in a foul mood - so let's try to calm her down with some zazamushi.
Right then! Here you are...
WHAT DID I JUST HEAR?
Better run for it!
*ALARM*
Perfect timing!
@BATTLE
Tenryū, look at this!
I'm not playing that game with you, give me that!
Your reflexes are... impressive, Tenryū.
Experience, discipline and practice, all standard qualities of the finest Kami of the Fleet.

Fields.MenuText: I wouldn't say tempers are a standard quality...
You should also count the ability to keep everyone walking around on eggshells.
Do you consider yourself to be the fiercest Belle?

Fields.DialogueText: Is that backtalk?!
Good, walking around on eggshells will only make them more agile.
I am certainly the fiercest ship in my fleet, which is why my kohai look up to me.
Wait, it says here that they've identified the thief!
Does it? You snatched the telegram away from me before I was able to finish reading.
Who saw this telegram before you did?
I'm not sure, maybe someone in communications...
There are people keeping information from me on this ship?
It's not like that, Tenryū. Comms takes in all messages, and delivers them to the proper people. it's their job.
It's PRIORITY that I see information FIRST!
*ALARM*
Actually, it's priority that we take care of these Morganas... Don't be mad at me.
AHHHH!!
@BATTLE
Kanchou!
*sigh*
Yes?
Why aren't we in pursuit of the German who stole the sword of Jimmu?

Fields.MenuText: I didn't even get a chance to look at the message yet!
A German stole the sword?
I'll do anything, as long as I stay on your good side.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I better give you an abridged version.
Hai. I'll explain the situation.
What did you call that earlier? Walking on eggshells? I don't see how that can be a bad saying.
A bearded German man stole the sword, and he is heading north. But I am not convinced he is headed to Germany. I think he might have a different destination in mind.
Where do you think he is headed?
... I don't know. I'll keep my contacts on his trail, but not too closely so he spooks.
And we'll follow course.
Exactly.
Well then, it looks as if we have a plan.
*ALARM*
Ready?
Need you even ask?
@BATTLE
Kanchou, as it turns out, the thief made it to the German border, but he didn't stop there.
Where is he headed now?
East, towards the Soviet Union.
He started in Japan. Why this long journey if he was only going to end up so close to where he started?
Perhaps to throw any followers off his scent. Foxes move left to right, in a zigzag formation, to elude threats.
Do they really?
Foxes are very clever creatures.

Fields.MenuText: Personally, I think foxes receive a little too much attention. They aren't that special.
Foxes don't get enough attention.
Personally, I prefer horses.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't let the kitsune hear you.
Perhaps you should pay a visit to the Fushimi Inari-Taisha shrine. It can be very beautiful in the spring.
Only a fearless horse who will charge into battle as his rider commands!
*ALARM*
Let's show these Morganas how clever we are.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, I was right. I've just received confirmation that the thief was seen crossing the western border into the Soviet Union.
Earlier, you made it seem as if the thief's intention to enter the Soviet Union was a sure thing. And yet you're only now receiving confirmation?
Kanchou, my experience guides me.

Fields.MenuText: At this point, I know better than to question anything beyond that.
What about that temper?
I think you just wanted to go to the Soviet Union.

Fields.DialogueText: As you can see, Kanchou, you experience is also guiding you.
Many would argue that I was only a passionate Kami of the Fleet.
This would be a good opportunity to brush up on my conversational Russian.
When are you going to make your move to take back the sword?
When it is right time to strike, we shall strike. Patience is key.
*ALARM*
And now I shall strike my enemy, like an angry dragon!
@BATTLE
Kanchou, I've been talking with the locals! I could tell you a grand story.
Let's hear it.
The sword isn't here in the Soviet Union any longer.
You must be joking. Where is it now?
Let me finish the story! We've identified the German man as an antiquities dealer who was working in Japan.
We believe he stole the sword of Jimmu in the hopes that, by giving said sword to Stalin, the Reds would back out of Eastern Europe. Of course, that didn't work.
Why would anyone... ever... think that plan would work?
There's word the man suffered some sort of mental break when he heard that the Reds had invaded Eastern Europe.

Fields.MenuText: How did you find this out from locals?
You talked with those locals for quite a while.
A mental break, eh?

Fields.DialogueText: Speaking conversational Russian is just one of the many venerable skills have.
Long enough to get the details I needed.
These are difficult times for those not strong of mind and spirit.
I kind of wish I could have been there to see the look on Stalin's face when faced with such a ridiculous proposal.
Tread lightly, Kanchou. Remember, the sword of which you speak is sacred.
Sacred in the eyes of the Japanese people, I'm sure. But the Soviets have no reason to view it as such.
... This much is true.
*ALARM*
Compared to this German man, the Morganas seem downright well thought out.
I can't argue with you there.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, why aren't we in Italy?
I wasn't aware that we had to be in Italy.
The Chokutō sword of Jimmu is headed that way! The insane German man who wears a beard plans to give the sword to the Italian Government in hopes to gain their favor.
The Italian Government.
The very one.
I see the man's mental fortitude hasn't improved. So, what's our plan?
We follow the man to the coast of Italy. Once there, I will have formulated a plan to retrieve the sacred sword. Prepare yourself - a fight's coming.

Fields.MenuText: We haven't eaten yet, and we can't fight on an empty stomach.
I'm too tired to battle.
Maybe I should get some doughnuts.

Fields.DialogueText: Let's put some food in our bellies. We'll need all the energy we can get.
You must bring honor to your ship, Kanchou!
What are doughnuts? What are you hiding from me?
*ALARM*
Steel yourself, Kanchou! A fight's coming a little sooner than I anticipated.
Why am I not surprised?
@BATTLE
There it is! Intelligence tells me that that ship there is the German's.
I can't believe we finally caught up with him. For an insane man, he does move quickly.
Something's not right here, this seems too easy...
Kanchou, look! There are Morganas hiding in the distance! I wonder if the man was able to draw them here, somehow.

Fields.MenuText: You have my binoculars.
I'll take your word for it. You can see in all directions.
He drew them here? How inventive of him.

Fields.DialogueText: Fine, fine. Take them back.
Yes! We need to prepare to fight. It won't be easy, but a difficult battle is the clay that legends are made from.
You're not suppose to be impressed, Kanchou. Come on!
There they are! These Morganas look more brutal than usual.
I'll go alert the crew. Ensure they're ready for the coming battle.
If we die today, we will have died from the hands of a worthy opponent.
Of course, I would rather not die, if possible.
@BATTLE
Captain! We need more reinforcements, portside!
The Morganas are coming from every direction! Where is Tenryū?
She was last seen towards the stern, moments ago.
Out of my way! I need to get to portside!
Oof!
If these Morganas think they can use this tactic on me successfully, they're mistaken!
Tenryū, look over there, I think the German is getting away! He's using the fight as a diversion!
What are your orders, Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: We have to suppress the Morganas, but I really want to catch that German...
Morganas are the priority, then we chase your German.
Fight in every direction!

Fields.DialogueText: Hai, Kanchou! Thinking foremost of my quarry will motivate me to dispatch the Funayūrei quickly.
Hai, Kanchou! To do that, I need to move to starboard side.
Hai! We will fight as if we have nothing to lose!
@BATTLE
It looks as if the tide is turning in our favor, Captain!
Now don't hold anything back! Fight with every ounce of strength you have! If we can break through these Morganas, we can get to the Sword of Jimmu.
Careful, Tenryū... We don't want to make ourselves an easy target.
We need more crew over here!
Let me move them over! KANCHOU, LOOK OUT!
*CRASH*
Urrrg, that was close! Who's on top of me?
Kanchou, you need to be more aware! Learn to see in all directions!
Tenryū... you saved me.
It was the honorable thing to do. But we must focus on the sword, thanks can come later.

Fields.MenuText: Yes, let's finish these Morganas!
Victory is nearly ours!
Tenryū, you're incredible!

Fields.DialogueText: Hai, Kanchou. It's time we take the sword back!
It's ours for the taking!
I haven't even finished the battle yet! Don't toss around praise until it has been won.
Ready yourself, Kanchou, we finish this battle now!
@BATTLE
It is ours again! The sword is ours!
Is it really over?
The Morganas have fled, and the German's ship is rudderless. I've sent a contingent of officers to retrieve the sword and apprehend the man.

Fields.MenuText: Oh good, I can get back to finding those doughnuts.
Time for a party!
Time for a nap!

Fields.DialogueText: Hey! You still never explained to me what doughnuts were...
There will be a time for party once the sword is back at the hands of the temple officials. Until then we cannot let our guard down.
If you need to rest, make it brief, Kanchou. We shouldn't let our guard down until we are in Kashima.
Hey, I never thanked you for saving me earlier...
I protect you as I do Japan itself. But thanks can come later.
It doesn't have to come later.
Kanchou, while I admire your tenacity, your persistence is beginning to get on my nerves.
Oh yes, your fury... say, it's about time for a break.
Hold it!
Oh no, you're upset again?
Not at YOU! Look, another group of Morganas in the distance. I am relieved we didn't let our guard down. Get ready for battle!
@BATTLE
@BATTLE
Look... the sword. I don't even know if I am worthy to hold such a sacred relic...
You are a "Kami of the Fleet" - I don't know who would be more worthy.
While the thought is tempting, I think I will leave the handling to the official caretakers of the sword. It would be the wisest thing to do.
I'm feeling hungry. Let's get some catfish kabayaki on the voyage back to Japan.

Fields.MenuText: That sounds delicious! I've worked up an appetite.
I don't feel very hungry right now.
Are there doughnuts?

Fields.DialogueText: Make sure to save room when we get to Kashima!
You should eat something Kanchou. We still have a journey ahead of us.
There's still hidden food on this ship? Who's keeping secrets from me!?
On second thought, Tenryū, let's go into a port to eat.
What's wrong with the mess?
Err.. well... the mess is all out of catfish.
HAHAHA!
It's funny?
OF COURSE IT'S NOT FUNNY! LET ME IN THAT MESS HALL!
Look out, cooks! A wild Tenryū is headed your way!
*CRASH*

Fields.MenuText: That girl never fails to keep me on my toes.
At least it's them and not me.

Fields.DialogueText: Another pack of Morganas? One more push, Tenryū!
